subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Greetings from a New Member
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-1621568251-1202253524=:37978
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hey Nellie, welcome aboard!!   I must say I beginning to think there are more women in this group the men.....hummmm its going to be very interesting right ladies!!!
   
  Juli

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
          Hi Nellie,
 
Welcome to our group.
I listened to your files, nice going for a beggining researcher.
 
Nellie, hold on to your hat because your not gonna be in kansas anymore !
 
your in for a wild ride of communication.
My name is Bruce I am one of the researchers here. I do research with
every box available today from Frank's box to RS469 and am pretty familiar with them all.
 
Any questions you may have or help you may need, please feel free to ask
you can also e-mail me off board if you like paranormalinvestigating@...
 
Bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: rednellie@...
Date: Tue, 5 Feb 2008 13:04:14 -0500
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Greetings from a New Member

      Hi! My name is Nellie and I am a new convert to ITC work. I've been
doing evps for a few years with a fair amount of success. One of the
things I have been experimenting with is using music. I play music
from the lifetimes of the spirits I'm trying to communicate with to
get the spirits intrigued enough to talk more. I took a quick look at
some of the old messages here, and will definitely have to experiment
with some of the suggestions you all have had about using music as
more of a carrier wave to make it easier for them to speak through.

What drew me to this group, though, is that I just made a Radio Shack
hack a couple of days ago and have been completely stunned by the
results. I'm getting more communications through it in 15 minutes
than I would usually get in evps over hours. I am absolutely blown
away. Even more interesting is that a spirit in my house who I've
never been able to get evps from is quite the chatterbox through the
hack. I have a couple of my first files in the folder Nellie's Files
that I found particularly interesting.

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/Nellie%27s%20Files/

Anyway, I am looking forward to learning from/with you all.

Nellie Kampmann
